scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle. [Monica] frowns slightly while [Bob] crosses his arms.
scenes.description: [Monica] continues, 'I understand your intentions, [Alex]. But what will you do if this happens again? It's a tricky situation for you.'

options.text: I'll address it if it comes up again. For now, let's focus on getting through today.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the concern and aim to stay in the present, showing good emotional perception and empathy while maintaining balance.

options.text: You're right, Monica. I need to think about clearer boundaries.
options.analysis: You agree with the concern, indicating a need to set clearer limits, reflecting good self-regulation but moderate motivation.

options.text: Honestly, if this keeps happening, maybe it's time for the team to learn to manage without me during my leave.
options.analysis: You take a firm stance on setting boundaries, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.
